body: There's some progress in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/14864 (demonstrates that adding grpc via add_subdirectory is easy, but there's still a problem with additional dependencies being required - but the comments in the example also partially explain what can be done about it).

gRPC can be added as a submodule as demonstrated here:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/df717e928a567abfdedaf6a6b3c9085836df719e/examples/cpp/helloworld/CMakeLists.txt#L49

In terms of requiring fewer dependencies (and not needing to populate some of grpc's submodules), one can make these additional settings:
1. pre-install a new-enough version of OpenSSL (boringssl then won't be used and go dependency will go away).
Examples:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/df717e928a567abfdedaf6a6b3c9085836df719e/test/distrib/cpp/run_distrib_test_cmake.sh#L22
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/df717e928a567abfdedaf6a6b3c9085836df719e/test/distrib/cpp/run_distrib_test_cmake.bat#L26

2. if you want to, you can also pre-install dependencies from submodules via cmake and specify
`gRPC_*_PROVIDER=package` to avoid building from the submodule (please note that it make make your build more complicated, so if you are already including grpc as a subdirectory, there should be no issue with cloning to submodules recursively and having gRPC built using the submodules (AFAIK there are no extra dependencies except those of boringssl).
Example how to pre-install:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/df717e928a567abfdedaf6a6b3c9085836df719e/test/distrib/cpp/run_distrib_test_cmake.sh#L24
Example which `gRPC_*_PROVIDER=package` options you can use
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/df717e928a567abfdedaf6a6b3c9085836df719e/test/distrib/cpp/run_distrib_test_cmake.sh#L56

3. you can also set gRPC_BUILD_TESTS=OFF and gRPC_BUILD_CODEGEN=OFF to end up with as small build as possible. But please note that the testing target won't be built anyway if you use EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL and you don't explicitly depend on them with your targets.
